snippet: A Yale professor’s economic data model is seeing a too-close-to-call presidential election.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column observes Yale economics professor, Ray C Fair, uses economic data to predict presidential elections; notes his model, based on the state of the weak economy alone, says the 2012 election is too close to call
lead_paragraph: A Yale professor’s economic data model is seeing a too-close-to-call presidential election.

headline.print_headline: This Year, a Weak Economy Is a Relative Term
headline.seo: Weak Economy Is a Relative Term This Election Year
headline.main: This Year, a Weak Economy Is a Relative Term
